summary: This document is a chain of emails from November 30 to December 1, 2021, between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the processing of a new tip letter regarding Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails coordinate the production of the tip and an associated small case file from a 2016 investigation to the defense, noting the materials are for impeachment purposes.

events.title: Investigation Meeting Referenced in Tip
events.description: A meeting referenced in the tip letter from October 2016 (initially thought to be 2017) prompted an investigation. An investigator opened a case but conducted limited steps, being dubious a criminal case could be made.

events.title: Tip Letter Received and Processed
events.description: A tip letter regarding Ghislaine Maxwell was received via mail, scanned, and discussed by the U.S. Attorney's Office for production to the defense team.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office received a new tip letter regarding Ghislaine Maxwell via mail on November 30, 2021.
The tip referenced a meeting from October 2016 (initially misremembered as 2017) that had previously prompted a limited investigation.
The associated case file from the 2016 investigation contained a small amount of bank records, notes from the meeting, and publicly available documents.
The prosecution team decided to produce the tip letter and the 2016 case file to the defense 'in an abundance of caution,' noting the material was for impeachment purposes.
Email correspondence shows internal coordination for document production, including Bates stamping (SDNY_GM_02775782-SDNY_GM_02776198) and drafting a cover letter.
